newsitem.title: UK: BT, MCI and Microsoft in global intranet pact.
newsitem.headline: BT, MCI and Microsoft in global intranet pact.

text.p: British Telecommunications Plc, MCI Communications Corp and U.S giant Microsoft Corp confirmed on Wednesday they plan to expand their alliances to develop a new range of global intranet services.

The companies said they planned to target two types of customer demands, including one for a range of solutions for businesses that want to build and manage their own intranet, a customised internal computer network.

The second, to be rolled out in early 1997, is for a fully-managed, network-based intranet service for customers seeking a communications partner that can build and manage their intranet on a global basis.

The firms said analysts expected that by 1999, products and services associated with building corporate intranets to account for $28 billion -- more than half of the total Internet market. The new services will offer the full range of Microsoft's messaging and intranet platforms, the firms said in a joint statement released here.
BT and MCI, which plan to merge in a $20 billion deal, will market the new services worldwide.

The services will be offered by Concert, the two companies' existing telecommunications joint venture. Concert InternetPlus Service, a global Internet backbone that became operational this week between the United States and Europe, will support intranet transport for the new services.
